channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3268] Dilbert Puts Twitter to Good Use
[+2790] Steve Carell's Daughter Profits From Paparazzi
item.description: Carell's 8-year-old daughter is learning how to profit from her dad's celebrity status by selling lemonade to paparazzi lurking around their Los Angeles home.

item.title: [+2169] Please don't hurt me [PIC]
[+1985] The Lonely Island - Threw It On The Ground
item.description: What, you think I'm stupid? I'm not a part of your system. My dad's not a phone.

item.title: [+1470] New Modern Warfare 2 Infamy Trailer (HD)
item.description: The new Modern Warfare 2 "Infamy" trailer revealed during tonight's NBC Sunday Night Football game. Footage includes the White House and Washington monument under attack.

item.title: [+1380] Don't Worry... I Got You Covered!
[+1369] The Politics of Spite
item.description: If Republicans think something might be good for the president, they’re against it — whether or not it’s good for America.

item.title: [+1198] 'Arrested Development' Script in Works!!
item.description: Narrator: Now the story of a wealthy family who lost everything ... and just may get some of it back.

item.title: [+1137] Mama? Are you in there?
[+975] How to tell if your Gecko is on drugs
item.description: A giant leaf-tailed gecko. Photo credit: Piotr Naskrecki.

item.title: [+864] Teen's junkyard windmills power African village
item.description: A 14-year-old boy kicked out of school because he couldn't afford $80 in fees has become a local hero after building a series of windmills to provide electricity and pump water in his Malawian village.

item.title: [+845] Incredible Camouflage Art by Liu Bolin (PICS)
item.description: Inspired by how some animals can blend into their environment, Liu Bolin from China uses camouflage principles to create amazing contemporary art.

item.title: [+775] Evolution of the Cell Phone
item.description: In 1956, the first automatic mobile telephone system weighed 88 pounds and were so heavy and power-hungry that they required permanent installation in a car or other vehicle. The phone served a mere 125 subscribers from 1956 to 1967.

item.title: [+750] Why American Credit Cards Suck
item.description: If you prefer to use a credit card when traveling abroad due to safety and better exchange rates, bad news. Other countries have adopted smartchip technology in their bank cards, and soon we Americans may be forced to use cash when traveling.

item.title: [+724] Superhero Facebook Status Updates
item.description: These days, everyone seems to be on Facebook. But what if superheroes like Batman, Spider-Man and Superman were updating their statuses like the rest of us?

item.title: [+680] 25 Hilarious Defaced Dollar Bills (PICS)
[+647] Conservatives remove liberal passages from the Bible
item.description: "The eager young men at Conservapedia are p.o.'d that the Bible might be seen as too liberal. So they've come up with the Wiki-style Conservative Bible Project, to make sure the Lord doesn't go all wobbly on us."

item.title: [+627] Could a 1.8 Gigayear Technology Gap Exist?
item.description: Are we the lone sentient life in the universe? So far, we have no evidence to the contrary, and yet the odds that not one single other planet has evolved intelligent life would appear, from a statistical standpoint, to be quite small.

item.title: [+586] Hey You Lady!!...I Wanted This Pose [PIC]
[+556] What's Really Inside Your Cup of Coffee?
item.description: WIRED digs deep and investigates just what is inside a cup of coffee...
